title: How to Get an IMEI Number on a Locked Phone

steps.title: Check the back of your phone.
steps.content: Check the back of your phone. If your phone's screen is unresponsive or you don't know the password, you may be able to find your IMEI on the phone itself, depending on the model. [1] X Research source If you have iPhone 6, iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone SE, iPhone 5s, iPhone 5c, or the iPhone 5, your IMEI will often be on the back of the phone. Some Android models may have the IMEI printed on the back as well.

steps.title: Check on or below the battery.
steps.content: Check on or below the battery. Some Android models with removal batteries have the IMEI printed on their underside. You may even find the IMEI under the battery cover. [2] X Research source Switch off your phone, remove the back cover, pop out the battery, and check to see if the IMEI number is on the battery. [3] X Research source This will not work if your phone does not have a removable battery.

steps.title: Pop out the SIM Tray.
steps.content: Pop out the SIM Tray. Most Phone models have their IMEI numbers engraved on the SIM tray. To pop out your SIM card and find the IMEI: [4] X Research source Get a SIM tool or bend a paperclip. [5] X Research source Locate the hole on the SIM tray. Gently insert the SIM tool or paperclip into the tray. Remove the paperclip or SIM tool and the tray should eject.

steps.title: Look through the phone's packaging.
steps.content: Look through the phone's packaging. If you didn't see the IMEI on the phone itself, you can check the box that your phone came in (if you still have it). Often the IMEI will be printed on the outside of the box or in the owner's manual.

steps.title: Call your network carrier and ask.
steps.content: Call your network carrier and ask. Sometimes your phone provider will give you access to an online portal that might have your IMEI number. If you explain your situation, you may also be able to verify your identity to get your IMEI number over the phone.

steps.title: Dial *#06# on your phone.
steps.content: Dial *#06# on your phone. Just open the Phone app on your home screen and enter this special code on the dial pad. After a few seconds, you'll see a screen containing your IMEI. If you were unable to find the IMEI this way, continue with this method.

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . It's the gray gear icon you'll find in your app list. Tap General . It's in the third group of settings. Tap About . This is the first option at the top of the menu. Scroll down to find the IMEI. You'll see the number next to "IMEI."

steps.title: Dial *#06# on your phone.
steps.content: Dial *#06# on your phone. Just open the Phone app on your home screen, dial this special code on the dial pad, and then tap the Call button. After a few seconds, you'll see a screen containing your IMEI. If you were unable to find the IMEI this way, continue with this method.

steps.title: Open the Settings app on your Android.
steps.content: Open the Settings app on your Android. You can find this by swiping up to the All Apps screen and tapping Settings , which is has a cogwheel symbol.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap the About Phone setting.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap the About Phone setting. You may have to scroll down pretty far to find it.

steps.title: Find the IMEI under the "IMEI" heading.
steps.content: Find the IMEI under the "IMEI" heading. You may have to tap IMEI first to see the number.
